vectors.name: Foreign or prohibited foreign entity counterparty
vectors.description: Counterparty is foreign-organized or may qualify as a prohibited foreign entity, creating baseline FEOC eligibility risk.
trigger_signals: no disclosure of ownership or control chain
broad affiliate or subcontractor performance rights
no obligation to disclose nationality or ownership of subcontractors

vectors.name: Material assistance via global supply chain or services
vectors.description: Contract permits sourcing, services, IP, software, firmware, or data flows that may constitute material assistance from a prohibited foreign entity.
trigger_signals: operator sole discretion sourcing from global supply chain
use of proprietary software, firmware, or algorithms controlled by operator
offshore data storage with no owner raw access

vectors.name: Operational control concentration and ineffective step-in
vectors.description: Operator retains day-to-day operational authority while the owner lacks effective step-in or IP rights to remediate FEOC risk.
trigger_signals: operator has primary day-to-day operational authority
remote monitoring and control retained by operator
owner has no license to operator IP or software on termination

vectors.name: Data ownership, access, and sovereignty failure
vectors.description: Operator owns operational data, permits offshore storage, and limits owner to reports only, undermining auditability and FEOC compliance proof.
trigger_signals: operator owns all operational, performance, or diagnostic data
data may be stored outside the United States
owner has no direct access to raw data or control systems
